title: Russlenat
author: Russlenat
content: After the buzz about Trump planning to make Bitcoin a national reserve and aiming to accumulate 1 million BTC for it, Pennsylvania has stepped up with its own bill to consider Bitcoin as their reserve. It’s unclear if this ties into the previously mentioned 1 million BTC, but either way, it’s great news for adoption. Moves like this can only push Bitcoin further into the mainstream spotlight.https://bitcoinnews.com/adoption/pennsylvania-bitcoin-reserve-act/QuoteThe bill allows Pennsylvania’s state treasurer to allocate up to 10% of the General Fund, Rainy Day Fund, and State Investment Fund into bitcoin and related assets. Together, these funds hold over $16 billion, meaning a substantial investment—potentially over $1.6 billion—could be directed toward bitcoin.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: This is one of the best part of the article I read and love it so much QuoteRepresentative Cabell explained the motivation behind the proposal in a memo, saying bitcoin could “shield portfolios from economic volatility.” He cited financial giants like BlackRock and Fidelity, which have already integrated bitcoin into their investment strategies.Simply put Bitcoin is an hedge against inflation and a tool of financial innovation. Although this bill is yet to be passed, I am hoping that it will go without any hurdles. It needs to be passed then other states would follow and the government. Recently my country's inflation rose to around 33% and I imagine if we had some Bitcoin reserve it would have acted as an hedge but the forces that be are working full time to ensure that it doesn't happen and the inflation keeps rising.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Trump is one big political figure in Pennsylvania, so it doesn't surprise me that they're planning to invest in bitcoin as a strategic reserve for the state. That being said, $1.6 billion isn't really any substantial amount for the Bitcoin market anymore. Just in the last 24 hours, there have been traded more than $43 billion worth of bitcoin, according to coinmarketcap.
